result.name: 2015-scottish-natural-heritage-snh-loch-paible-north-uist-sediment-flats-site-condition-monitor1
result.notes: The purpose of this study was to carry out site condition monitoring (SCM) of the mudflat feature within Loch Paible and biotope mapping of the sedimentary flats. SCM was inaugurated at this site in 2004, which provided a baseline for the current study. The principle aims were to: (1) identify any deterioration in the condition of the mudflat feature; and (2) to form a judgement on its current condition. The approach taken to achieve this aim was to resurvey two representative, relocatable transects established in 2004.

organization.name: marine-environmental-data-information-network
organization.title: Marine Environmental Data & Information Network
organization.description: MEDIN is a partnership of UK organisations committed to improving access to marine data. Our partners are both public and private sector.

result.title: 2015 Scottish Natural Heritage (SNH) Loch Paible, North Uist sediment flats site condition monitoring and biotope mapping survey

extras.value: ["Not for navigational use; This survey recorded no species or biotope occurrences that SNH consider as sensitive; all records may therefore be released in response to requests covered by Environmental Information Regulations or Freedom of Information Regulations; additionally its re-use and dissemination is permissible under Open Government Licence terms. Any re-use of this data will acknowledge the copyright owner."]
Colin Moore (originator); Scottish Natural Heritage (SNH), Headquaters (custodian)
